    IntersectionExtensionalSetSimplifier
    Between an extensional set and another Set (either intensional or extensional, since it resorts to "in" that works for both): { e1, ..., e_m } intersection Set ---> (if e1 in Set then {e1} else {}) union ...

    SetIntersectExtensionalSetEqualToEmptySetSimplifier
    S ∩ {t1,…,tn} = ∅ → (t1 ∉ S) ∧ (S ∩ {t2,…,tn} = ∅)
    SetIntersectExtensionalSetEqualToEmptySetTopRewriter  
    SetOfArgumentTuplesForFunctionOccurringInExpression
    The set of argument tuples for ƒ : Α → Β occurring in an expression E is denoted ocƒ[E] and inductively defined as follows:
    if E does not contain ƒ, ocƒ[E] is ∅ if E is ƒ(t) for t a tuple, ocƒ[E] is {t} if E is ƒ, ocƒ[E] is Α if E is g(E′) for g a function symbol distinct from ƒ and t a k-tuple of expressions,
    if g(E′) is if C the E1 else E2 and C does not contain ƒ, then ocƒ[E] is
    if C then ocƒ[E1] else ocƒ[E2] otherwise, ocƒ[E] is ocƒ[t1] ∪ … ∪ ocƒ[tk] if E is Qx:CE′ for Q an arbitrary quantifier, x a variable, C a boolean formula not containing ƒ, and E′ the quantified expression, then ocƒ[E] is
    ⋃x:Cocƒ[E′] if E is Qx:CE′ for Q an arbitrary quantifier, x a variable, C a boolean formula containing ƒ, and E′ the quantified expression, then ocƒ[E] is
    ⋃x(ocƒ[C] ∪ ocƒ[E′])
    UnionEmptySetSimplifier
    {} union Set ---> Set
    UnionEmptySetTopRewriter  
    UnionOfSetsEqualEmptySetSimplifier
    S1 ∪ S2 = ∅ → S1 = ∅ and S2 = ∅
    UnionOfSetsEqualEmptySetTopRewriter
